duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage administrative tasks and provide patient support services in a non-diagnostic laboratory setting.
Interact directly with patients to provide updates and answer questions related to their individual case.
Adhere to School of Medicine and Departmental guidelines concerning conduct, safety, and patient confidentiality.
Maintain a professional appearance and provide proper notification of absences or tardiness.
Demonstrate alertness and adaptability to changes in schedule and work conditions, respond appropriately, and complete assigned tasks effectively.
Assume responsibility for on-going professional development and continuing education, and maintain a clean and safe working environment.
Seek information and ask for assistance from senior personnel when necessary regarding difficult or questionable clinical results.
Dispose of biological specimens in designated hazard containers, report malfunctions promptly, and perform tasks utilizing universal precautions for bloodborne pathogens.
Check Andrology lab emails, greetings andrology patients, and perform additional tasks as required to support the lab.

education_certification.credential: High School or equivalent (Bachelor's degree preferred)
